sentences.english: "Piano lessons, " I tell Kevin. "Same as last year. "
sentences.chinese: “學鋼琴”，我報告凱文，“和客歲同樣”。

sentences.english: Andrew Graham, via Facebook: The easy answer here is Kevin Durant.
sentences.chinese: 最簡單的答案就是凱文杜蘭特。

sentences.english: Alexis approaches Carroll and shoots him.
sentences.chinese: 亞歷克西斯走近凱文，射殺了他。

sentences.english: Kevin grabbed for his wrist, knocking a sushi roll across the living room.
sentences.chinese: 凱文抓住了他的手腕，一卷壽絲被打的飛出了大廳。

sentences.english: Kevin knew winning the lottery was a long shot, but he bought a lottery ticket anyway.
sentences.chinese: 凱文知道中樂透的機率不大，但還是買了一張彩券。

sentences.english: Kevin went snorkeling in Kenting to see the beautiful coral.
sentences.chinese: 凱文到墾丁浮潛，看到了美麗的珊瑚礁。

sentences.english: was born in Elmira, New York and did most of his growing up in central Pennsylvania.
sentences.chinese: 凱文出生於紐約州的艾爾邁拉，長於賓夕法尼亞。

sentences.english: Sooner or later, it might all come crashing down. But Kevin did not really care.
sentences.chinese: 早早晚晚，這種生活會土崩瓦解，可凱文並布在乎。

sentences.english: No way, Jose! You almost made Kevin bald when you did his hair.
sentences.chinese: 沒門，你給凱文理髮的時候，差點給他理成了禿子。

sentences.english: Someone could make a case for Kevin Durant, but it would be a weak one.
sentences.chinese: 有人也許會說凱文杜蘭特，但是他實在是太孱弱了。

sentences.english: A few months later Kevin attempted to rob a bank.
sentences.chinese: 幾個月之後，凱文企圖打劫銀行。

sentences.english: Ralph says Kevin's "voice is so monotone that it lulls me to sleep every time I hear it."
sentences.chinese: 拉爾夫說凱文的聲音太單調，每次聽到都想睡覺。

sentences.english: Kevin is cool and Myolie is beautiful.
sentences.chinese: 凱文涼爽，杏兒是美麗的。

sentences.english: Well, Adriana says, "Take this guy, Kevin."
sentences.chinese: 呃，阿德里亞納說，“比如，凱文。

sentences.english: Kevin was a guard of gigantic strength.
sentences.chinese: 凱文擁有巨人般力氣的守衛。

sentences.english: Kevin Kelly once explained how to calculate the date of your death.
sentences.chinese: 凱文凱利曾經解釋過如何計算死亡的日期。

definition: member of the US House of Representatives
chair (or president, speaker etc) of national congress
deputy governor (of a province or colony)/lieutenant governor of US state
Gore (name)/Al Gore (1948-), US vice-president 1993-2001 under Bill Clinton, subsequently environmental campaigner and Nobel Peace laureate

pinyin: Ying1 guo2 Wen2 hua4 Xie2 hui4
